column1: Intellectual Property, Data and Information Law MSc
column5: The MSc in Intellectual Property, Data and Information Law is a programme designed for non law graduates who wish to acquire legal knowledge in areas relevant to the creative industries, including the data and computer industries but also sectors such as music, publishing or film. All students take compulsory modules in the core IP disciplines (copyright and designs law; patent law). In addition, students will have much flexibility to select a range of modules.
